meanings.def: to hit somebody/something with the flat part of your hand
examples: She slapped his face hard.
She slapped him hard across the face.
‘Congratulations!’ he said, slapping me on the back.
I felt like I had been slapped in the face.
She slapped his hand away.
She slapped the boy on the leg.
I'll slap you if you do that again.

meanings.def: to put something on a surface in a quick, careless and often noisy way, especially because you are angry
examples: He slapped the newspaper down on the desk.
She slapped a $10 bill into my hand.

meanings.def: to hit against something with the noise of somebody being slapped
examples: The water slapped against the side of the boat.
I could hear bare feet slapping down the corridor.

related: slap something on something | slap something

meanings.def: the action of hitting somebody/something with the flat part of your hand
examples: She gave him a slap across the face.
He gave me a hearty slap on the back.
Her mother delivered a hard slap and sent her to bed.
She gave him a playful slap on the arm as everyone laughed.
That boy needs a slap!

meanings.def: the noise made by hitting somebody/something with the flat part of your hand; a similar noise made by something else
examples: the gentle slap of water against the shore
He hit the water with a resounding slap.

meanings.def: make-up (= coloured substances used on the skin to make yourself look more attractive or to change your appearance)
enthusiastic kissing and cuddling between lovers
an action that seems to be intended as a deliberate way of offending and showing lack of respect for somebody
examples: The closure of the school is a slap in the face to the local community.
We're hoping that she gets off with a slap on the wrist from the judge.
